column4: Quick question -- what's the verdict on DRI support in the most recent proprietary fglrx binary?
So is downloadthemall! in conjunction in terms of a Firefox extension.
wget is a good command-line one.
Y'know ...
I hate to sound to snotty, but I just want my ATI card to work, you know?
I love the fact that I can fuck with Linux as much as I want, but, uh, I want my ATI card to WORK.  I don't care if the binary is proprietary or not for some applications.
Oh, sorry unop.
kids and women frequent this channel .. they'd appreciate some gentlemanleness :)
!botabuse | sable  :)
Eh, sometimes I forget that not everyone curses produsely.
That'd be great if some packages don't contradict one another.
And if you have conflicting repositories ...
Hmm?  Isn't there a special boot --debug command?
have you followed the instructions as per !ati ?
What's the verdict on ATI R300 support as of the 8.33.thingamajig?
Unop, I'm a little leery -- the last time I did the DRI issues were ... not good.
*thingamajig = update
things change quite fast with ubuntu -- :)
I thought it was the x1000series.
Unop -- I think it was ... what, four months ago?
worth a try then , definitely :)
